title: On the trail of Tarik Kerbouci, the elusive French drug baron
summary: Tarik Kerbouci, a French drug kingpin known as 'Bison,' suspected of orchestrating major cocaine shipments, has so far thwarted the law by using his networks, which stretch between France, the United Arab Emirates and Algeria.

title: French PM survives two no-confidence votes
summary: Only 128 MPs voted in favor for the first and 122 for the second, with both votes on Wednesday falling short of the 289-vote majority required to bring down the government.

title: US wavers as Trump's Gaza plan triggers global backlash
summary: Administration officials and the White House have sought to nuance Donald Trump's pledge that the US would 'take over' the Gaza Strip. Secretary of State Marco Rubio claims the idea 'was not meant as hostile."

title: Trump's Gaza project is one of ethnic cleansing
summary: By advocating a lasting US takeover of the Gaza Strip and forcing Palestinians out, President Donald Trump is endorsing the vision of Israel's racist, supremacist far right, and announcing a war crime.

title: Foreign tourists shun India, too expensive and too polluted
summary: According to official figures, only 9.52 million tourists visited the country in 2023. New Delhi is focusing on religious tourism and trying to develop places of pilgrimage.

title: Death of the Aga Khan: What is Ismailism, the esoteric branch of Shia Islam?
summary: Karim Al-Hussaini, also known as the Aga Khan, died on Tuesday, February 4, aged 88. A colossally wealthy philanthropist, he was also the imam of the Nizari Ismaili faith, an esoteric branch of Shia Islam that changed the history of the Middle East.

title: War in the DRC: In the town of Sake, the M23 rebels settle in but the inhabitants don't return
summary: While Goma has fallen into the hands of the rebel group and the Rwandan army, Sake, just a few kilometers away, remains largely abandoned. The more daring inhabitants stroll the streets by day, but return to their camps at night.

title: Trump stuns world by considering US control of Gaza
summary: After a meeting with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, President Donald Trump declared the US 'will take over' Gaza and move Palestinians out of the enclave as part of a 'long-term ownership' goal.

title: Rwanda's expansionism risks internationalizing the conflict in the DRC
summary: The capture of Goma by the M23 rebel movement and Rwandan army forces has positioned Kigali as the dominant power in the region. However, Uganda and Burundi, neighbors of the Congo, are determined to protect their areas of influence.

title: Argentina announces exit from the World Health Organization
summary: Following in US President Donald Trump's footsteps, Argentine President Javier Milei's office said the country would pull out of the World Health Organization, citing differences over handling the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Six Nations Rugby: Suspended for three weeks, France's Ntamack will miss key England game
summary: Romain Ntamack, red-carded against Wales in the opening match last Friday, has been handed a three-week suspension for his foul on Ben White and will miss the match against England on Saturday.

title: Rahim Al-Hussaini named as 50th Aga Khan, spiritual leader of Ismaili Muslims
summary: Educated in the US Rahim Al-Hussaini is the eldest son of the former Aga Khan, who died in Portugal on Tuesday.

title: Ukraine's rare earths become part of aid negotiation
summary: On Monday, Donald Trump demanded access to the war-torn country's strategic resources in exchange for American support in its fight against Russia's invasion. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said he was 'open' to the prospect.

title: In Sweden, 'many questions remain unanswered' after country's 'worst mass murder'
summary: Eleven people were killed and several seriously injured in an attack on an adult education center in Örebro on Tuesday. The suspect was found dead.

title: 'Trump is showing the face of an American right that has totally dropped its inhibitions'
summary: The US president's violent rhetoric may seem new, but it merely cancels euphemizing efforts carried out since the 2000s, first by communications consultant Frank Luntz, writes Jean-Baptiste Fressoz in his column.

title: Balzac by Rodin: Anatomy of a statue
summary: How did the sculptor Auguste Rodin form his famous statue of Honoré de Balzac, completed in 1898? His preparatory plaster casts and all his documentation are the subject of an exhibition at the Musée Rodin in Paris until March 2.

title: EU announces fees on e-commerce packages and investigation into Shein
summary: EU officials announced new fees on packages from e-commerce platforms, such as Shein and Temu, as well as an investigation into Shein over unsafe products, after the US Postal Service briefly suspended deliveries from China and Hong Kong.

title: Gisèle Pelicot's daughter to publish book about rape victims
summary: Caroline Darian's 'Pour que l'on se souvienne' ('For us to remember') is to hit bookstands on March 5. She has campaigned for awareness about the use of drugs to commit sexual abuse and in 2022 wrote a book about the family's ordeal.
